item.title: Wtf is wrong with this?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

It’s basic java… No single method or constructor can be greater than 64kb in size. So basically, your single method168(or whatever it is) is over 64 kb, which is absolutely RIDICULOUS!!! Do what I did, make it load the information from a MySQL table. Or if you don’t want to do that, write the info to a file, and simply make that method parse the information in that file.

ITEM_ID: 11700//Zammy God sword I think...
ITEM_NAME: Zamorak Godsword
//The rest of your info, rotations, color change, model ID, etc would follow the same style, and just repeat with a delimiter for each Item, like "[End of Item]"

That way, you won’t run into a “code too large” error. Or you could be smart and just not use custom items at all.

Read full topic

Class8.java:138: code too large[/quote]

tbh Miss Silab, not many of us know enough about coding to make all items load threw the cache like you do. So please dont call us people Morons

ON TOPIC- try using a switch statement instead of doing all of that. Enabling switch statements in that file ill allow MANY items to be created instead of it just being limited, your multiplying it by almost 20[/quote]
What… And it’s not hard making them load through the cache. Especially since Tom made a tool that does it for you…
